channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox, 11th December
item.description:
Dead fox on grass verge next to busy pavement, many families and children use this path/ cycle way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-9, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Potholes on length of old bath road cheltenham, 11th December
item.description:
Between Reeves Field mini roundabout and Pilley Bridge/ Charlton Lane mini roundabout there are still many dangerous potholes for car drivers and CYCLISTS. Appreciate repair ongoing May 2023 to February 2024, but reemphasising the urgent need for these repairs. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 143, Old Bath Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard from uneven edging on pavement. Previous repair approx 6 months ago has failed - chunk of cement detached., 11th December
item.description:
On pavement edge outside number 4/6 Allenfield Road. Right hand side of road as coming along Peregrine Road towards left hand bend on to Allenfield Road. By BT manhole cover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Allenfield Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes in the junction of Farriers Reach, 11th December
item.description:
In the junction of Farriers Reach and Stoke Orchard Road there are multiple potholes, some areas deeper than a golf ball and others wider than a dinner plate. I've noticed the issue for a number of weeks now, at least a month but I imagine the potholes were there but a lot smaller for some time beforehand.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farriers Reach, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light timing isn't right at night time., 11th December
item.description:
The timing of these lights and the next set have been out, at night time, since the road markings were done a couple of months ago. I have been sat for 30-40 seconds at both sets of traffic lights when there is no traffic coming out of Barnett Way and Corinium Ave. As you can imagine, this is very frustrating.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): C&G Roundabout, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Broken glass on ground near bandstand, 11th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Terrace, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 11th December
item.description:
email rec 11/12/2023 - My neighbour as informed me she has reported our flood to you, possibly from underground pipes being blocked. Situation seems to be worse after this weekends rainfall. Will anyone be coming out to assess the site?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in the middle of the road, very difficult to avoid as cars are usually parked parked, 11th December
item.description:
In the middle of Hatherley Court Road between St Stephens Road and Bournside Road. Has been like this for several months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Hatherley Court Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement collapse, 11th December
item.description:
Damage to pavement on Harp Hill South side below Battledown Centre. Pavement collapse following constant parking and manoeuvring by Severn Tankers over past week. Existing repair has been parked on and joint with good pavement has fractured and collapsed over a stretch of 1-2 metres, throwing up bits of tarmac.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 11th December
item.description:
email rcvd (see attached trail) 08.12.23 - Hello there, As you can see from my correspondence below, there are two lights out of order near to where I live. The first one is in Keynshambury Road (GL52 6HB). It is the only street light we have in this road. And the other is on the London Road, immediately opposite to the entrance to Keynshambury Road. I hope that you are able to repair these as soon as possible. Thanks very much.
Report on FixMyStreet
